result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald J Badtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (04/18/2019)
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - one year (04/18/2018)    NOTE:  wrong date, only extended one day.

1:12 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Jennifer Coats not present in court.  Court instructs Clerk to contact the agent and have her submit something in writing as to why she was not here.  Court finds good cause that the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court informs defendant that if probation is extended again, the Court can fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain one.

Court adjourned at 1:14 p.m.
Probation review hearing on March 19, 2018 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ronald J Badtke
Current: 628 Otter Ave, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2016)
Prior: N9622 Island Rd, Ripon, WI 54971
From Atty Joey Roeth - defendant's new address is:  628 Otter Ave  Oshkosh, WI  54901

10:12 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin and County of Green Lake.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to 2016TR629 and count 1 amended to misdemeanor possess narcotic drug in violation of 961.41(3g)(b) and count 2 amended to misdemeanor possess THC, and count 3 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 2 as amended.  Court orders count 3 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

2016TR629

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the defendant guilty and sentences the defendant to:

-Forfeiture and costs totalling $937.50.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Blood Draw fee - $42.50
-AODA (winnebago)
-DL revocation - 6 months

Court sentences the defendant to: 

2016CF33

Count 1 - 30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

Count 2 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS(EACH COUNT):

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court grants the defendant 2 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

Court adjourned at 10:23 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.

11:24 a.m. Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - believes the matter is resolved but requests another court date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 17, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.. 

Court adjourned at 11:26 a.m.
Attorney Joey Roeth
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

11:59 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - have an offer and all Discovery.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 12, 2016 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:59 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:34 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Atty Privat - waiting on additional information from DA's office.  Court sets for Status Hearing on July 26, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 10:34 a.m.
State's

for Discovery - Defendant's
Status hearing on June 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.

3:09 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on June 14, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:11 p.m.
By Atty Barb Privat
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.

2:10 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Defendant qualified for PD representation and will be representing him.  Court will set for Status Hearing on May 3, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:13 p.m.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
